DOC.brief_title: Early Intervention vs. Standard Palliative Care Improving End-of-Life Care Advanced Cancer Patients
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine efficacy early intervention palliative care program comprise phone-based nurse educator share medical appointment improve end-of-life care patient advance lung , gastrointestinal , genitourinary , breast cancer . - Compare symptom management , quality life , match preference care care receive patient treat early intervention palliative care program v standard care program . - Compare health care utilization patient treat intervention . OUTLINE : This randomize , multicenter study . Patients stratify accord cancer diagnosis ( lung v breast vs gastrointestinal v genitourinary ) participate center . Patients randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I ( early-intervention palliative care program ) : Patients complete Medical Care Questionnaire receive computer-generated prescription letter outline problem identify ; patient 's physician also receive copy letter . Patients receive series phone call weekly 4 week least monthly nurse educator . The phone call address 3 major area : coordination palliative care option cancer center patient 's community , include referral psychological spiritual counseling , social work consultation , financial guidance , home health , palliative care hospice service , bereavement counsel family ; problem-solving therapy , focus identification problem , definition achievable goal , plan reach goal , evaluation success ; tailor psycho-educational module `` Charting Your Course '' , cover end-of-life topic symptom management , advance care planning , communication health care team family member , spirituality , nutrition . Patients also receive information regard purpose time/location symptom management , share medical appointment ( SMAs ) , attend person call participate via speaker phone . SMAs 1.5-hour monthly session conduct physician nurse practitioner accommodate 10-12 patient caregiver . The session include welcome/social period , question answer/peer discussion , interactive educational session , opportunity one-on-one nurse practitioner appointment focus brief review patient ' medical treatment plan . - Arm II ( standard palliative care program ) : Patients receive standard palliative care physician/nurse practitioner team access palliative care nurse discretion treat physician . Patients complete Functional Assessment Chronic Illness Therapy-Palliative Care baseline every 3 month thereafter . Patients caregiver complete survey measure perception quality patient 's cancer care baseline 1 month . A caregiver family member complete After-Death Bereaved Family Member Interview evaluate adequacy patient care 3 month post-patient death . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 450 patient accrue study .
